comment: He is sweet, but he would not be able to save his life if it came to teaching. He does give extra credit, but he does not know where to draw the line between giving out homework. The exams are lockdown browser with webcam in class. You will definitely fail if you don't go to his class, but his lectures are hard to understand. NOT WORTH IT.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Yoshi is a very nice professor who actually cares about his students passing. His class is very hard and he is pretty new to teaching but if you study what he highlights on his power points you will pass. It is exactly what will be on the exam. There is extra credit opportunity and he curves the exams. It is a lot of studying for his class.

This is my honest review. Overall, I do not recommend him. He is nice, but he does not know where to draw the line when it comes to giving homework. It's not just the homework, he also don't know how to teach. Class attendance is mandatory, it is a burden going to his lectures, and IF YOU MISS LECTURES, THEN YOU WILL FAIL. Think before taking him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Yoshinaga is an extremely kind and caring professor. Microbiology is hard but he makes very clear power points with the important topics hilighted so you know what to focus on studying. He gives a lot of extra credit and homework assignments to help with your grade. Tests are difficult but fair and similar to the homework.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: He is very nice, but he does not know how to teach. He have strong accent.  He reads off the PowerPoints and his exams are hard. Aaron of homework throughout the week and the online quizzes are done with Webcam. His exams are taken in class in lockdown browser. I genuinely think of him as a nice person, but being nice is not gonna help me pass.

The structure of his class, and sometimes his teaching style, are pretty bad. Each week there is 2+ assignments that have about 70+ questions each, and a quiz. Very unorganized and constantly changed due dates. Students are punished for him not making it through lectures, as we had to learn it ourselves. You will need 4-5 outside of class, weekly.
This is one of the worst professors I have ever had.

Professor Yoshi is nice, he tries his best to help however there is a lot that he assigns. There is way too much homework, quizzes are hard to you have to really study the slides. Exams are pretty difficult but he does offer extra credit, in general Microbiology is hard but the way the grading scale is and that amount of work he gives is too much.
